hints.content:
There are $\blueD{7}$ rows.

They are $\greenD{42}$ total bricks.

[[☃ image 1]]

What is the $\purpleC{\text{size of the groups}}$?

options.alt: A tape diagram with 2 tapes of equal lengths. The first tape is labeled 42 and the second tape with 7 equal parts each labeled with a question mark. A curved bracket across the bottom and the width of the second tape is labeled with the words 7 equal groups. !

hints.content:
We can write this as a multiplication problem. 

$\blueD{\text{ number of groups}}\times\purpleC{\text{size of the group}}= \greenD{\text{ total}}$

So, $\blueD{7}\times\purpleC{\text{?}} = \greenD{42}$

We can also write this as a division problem. 

$\greenD{\text{total}}\div\blueD{\text{ number of groups}}=\purpleC{\text{ size of the groups}}$

So, $\greenD{42}\div \blueD{7}=\purpleC{\text{?}}$

The equations that would help us find out how many bricks are in each row are:  

 - $\blueD{7}\times\purpleC{\text{?}} = \greenD{42}$
 - $\greenD{42}\div \blueD{7}=\purpleC{\text{?}}$

question.content:
Ella has built $7$ rows of the chimney for her house. She has used $42$ bricks. Each row has the same number of bricks.

**Which equations would help us find out how many bricks are in each row?**
